summary: This document is a chain of emails between U.S. Attorney's Office personnel discussing scheduling a meeting and obtaining approval for a 'Sweden travel memo' related to Epstein. It shows administrative coordination within the Southern District of New York regarding an Epstein-related travel matter in early 2020.

persons.name: Geoff
persons.context: Mentioned as the reason one correspondent is tied up during a scheduling attempt on February 4, 2020.

events.title: Submission of Sweden Travel Memo
events.description: A memo regarding travel to Sweden related to Epstein is dropped off for approval, having received OIA approval that morning.

events.title: Scheduling Attempt for Meeting
events.description: Multiple emails are exchanged attempting to schedule a meeting to discuss the Epstein travel approval form.

keyFacts: The correspondence is between personnel at the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York.
The subject is 'Epstein -- travel approval form' and a related 'Sweden travel memo'.
The emails show administrative efforts to secure final DOJ approval for the travel memo in late January and early February 2020.
The document indicates ongoing legal or investigative activity related to Epstein in early 2020, months after his death.
The identities of the primary correspondents are redacted, indicated by the '>' symbols and generic 'From:'/'To:' fields.
